summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering the shifts of August 9-10, 2019. It details routine prison operations and, most significantly, the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019, leading to a medical emergency, CPR, and transport to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The unnamed lieutenant who assumed duties for the Morning Watch on August 10, 2019, and documented the initial response to the Epstein medical emergency.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in cell Z06-220. He was found unresponsive, and CPR was initiated by prison staff.

events.title: EMS Transport to Hospital
events.description: EMS arrived at 6:43 AM and continued CPR. At 7:10 AM, EMS and BOP staff departed with Epstein via ambulance to a local hospital, with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Dry Cell
events.description: At 3:58 PM, an inmate (implied to be Epstein based on context and register number) was transferred to a special housing dry cell under staff watch.

events.title: Epstein Transferred to Psych Observation
events.description: At 7:24 PM on August 10 (after the morning medical event), an inmate was transferred to special housing for psychological observation. This log entry appears to be for a different inmate, as Epstein had already been transported to the hospital.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #476318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein by prison staff and later by responding EMTs before he was transported to a local hospital via ambulance at 7:10 AM.
The logs show Epstein was in a 'dry cell' under staff watch the evening before his death (August 9, 3:58 PM).
The prison logs document routine security checks, counts, and system malfunctions (fire alarm, public address system) during the shifts surrounding Epstein's death.
The ending inmate count changed from 758 to 757 after Epstein's transport to the hospital, confirming his removal from the facility.
